Back to Felix Mendelssohn

Felix Mendelssohn

Sechs Präludien und Fugen, op. 35

c. 1827–1837 · MWV U 66, 91, 105–106, 108, 116, 122, 126, 128–129, 131, 135

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

Total duration: 40' 30"

  • 1. E minor, Praeludium
  • 1. E minor, Fuga
  • 2. D major, Praeludium
  • 2. D major, Fuga
  • 3. B minor, Praeludium
  • 3. B minor, Fuga
  • 4. A-flat major, Praeludium
  • 4. A-flat major, Fuga
  • 5. F minor, Praeludium
  • 5. F minor, Fuga
  • 6. B-flat major, Praeludium
  • 6. B-flat major, Fuga

The preludes and fugues are spread over multiple entries in the Leipzig Edition catalogue.

no.MWV Uyear
1116 · 661836 · c. 1827
2129 · 1051836 · 1834
3131 · 911836 · 1832
4122 · 1081836 · 1835
5126 · 1061836 · 1834
6135 · 1281837 · 1836

Recommended editions

  • Associated Board · ed. Howard Ferguson
  • Henle · HN 861 · Klavierwerke / Band II · ed. Ullrich Scheideler / Christa Jost

1. E minor, Praeludium

Duration: 2'

Difficulty: 4

1. E minor, Fuga

Duration: 5' 30"

Difficulty: 4

2. D major, Praeludium

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 3.5

2. D major, Fuga

This fugue also exists in versions for organ, for one player (MWV W19, a fughetta) and two players (MWV V1 no. 2).

Duration: 3'

Difficulty: 3.5

Difficulty: 4
